name: Baked Salmon
author: lola
summary: A very easy recipe to do. Good tasting, too. Can be served with rice or baked potatoes or eaten by itself. If desired, potatoes can be baked during baking time.
directions: Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line a baking dish with enough aluminum foil to be able to fold over ingredients
Stir together the tomato, mushrooms, onion, and scallions in a bowl; spread into the bottom of the prepared dish
Lay the salmon fillets over the mixture
Dot the salmon with the butter
Arrange the lemon slices atop the butter pieces
Fold the foil over the salmon, and press edges together to seal
Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 1 hour
